bwwExcerpt: Blankenbuehler's production just never stops for a moment, sometimes at the expense of the narrative flow and certainly at some cost when it comes to getting to know and care about these characters, especially Donny and Julia, played by actors who never fully connect emotionally, not least because they don't really get enough scenes to help them. The dancing - the ensemble is mostly playing the swing kids at the clubs where the band plays - is, however, spectacular, not least for its grounding i
showScoreExcerpt:
“Blankenbuehler's production just never stops for a moment, sometimes at the expense of the narrative flow...The dancing is, however, spectacular…‘Bandstand’ has a serviceable score, although there is so much music that it often tends to blur…The book has moments of freshness and all kinds of potential, but it never strives enough for poetic heights or depth of characters…All in all, this is a show with some frustrations as well as many pleasures for the ear and eye.”

Read more
